messages.message:
Hey all, in reference to this thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753986585530409), I have a question: Currently, when you run `cs up <service>` it tries to (a) build the service and (b) run the service. This ensures that changes to code are reflected in the docker container that's running the service.

However, it also causes a lot of rebuilds when things go wrong. Wondering if we should require manually running `make build-docker && cs restart <svc>`  for services that you know have changed? Not ideal, but it would prevent the rebuilds from going haywire.

I also asked Crafting to limit the number of retries when rebuilding/rerunning a service, so it doesn't churn indefinitely.
